title: Homework_03
text:
Q3
Set.seed sets the random coordinates to a value so they don’t change on you. Using the formulas provided by the textbook I was able to convert to radius and theta.

set.seed

function (seed, kind = NULL, normal.kind = NULL, sample.kind = NULL) 
{
    kinds <- c("Wichmann-Hill", "Marsaglia-Multicarry", "Super-Duper", 
        "Mersenne-Twister", "Knuth-TAOCP", "user-supplied", "Knuth-TAOCP-2002", 
        "L'Ecuyer-CMRG", "default")
    n.kinds <- c("Buggy Kinderman-Ramage", "Ahrens-Dieter", "Box-Muller", 
        "user-supplied", "Inversion", "Kinderman-Ramage", "default")
    s.kinds <- c("Rounding", "Rejection", "default")
    if (length(kind)) {
        if (!is.character(kind) || length(kind) > 1L) 
            stop("'kind' must be a character string (RNG to be used).")
        if (is.na(i.knd <- pmatch(kind, kinds) - 1L)) 
            stop(gettextf("'%s' is not a valid abbreviation of an RNG", 
                kind), domain = NA)
        if (i.knd == length(kinds) - 1L) 
            i.knd <- -1L
    }
    else i.knd <- NULL
    if (!is.null(normal.kind)) {
        if (!is.character(normal.kind) || length(normal.kind) != 
            1L) 
            stop(gettextf("'%s' must be a character string", 
                "normal.kind"), domain = NA)
        normal.kind <- pmatch(normal.kind, n.kinds) - 1L
        if (is.na(normal.kind)) 
            stop(gettextf("'%s' is not a valid choice", normal.kind), 
                domain = NA)
        if (normal.kind == 0L) 
            stop("buggy version of Kinderman-Ramage generator is not allowed", 
                domain = NA)
        if (normal.kind == length(n.kinds) - 1L) 
            normal.kind <- -1L
    }
    if (!is.null(sample.kind)) {
        if (!is.character(sample.kind) || length(sample.kind) != 
            1L) 
            stop(gettextf("'%s' must be a character string", 
                "sample.kind"), domain = NA)
        sample.kind <- pmatch(sample.kind, s.kinds) - 1L
        if (is.na(sample.kind)) 
            stop(gettextf("'%s' is not a valid choice", sample.kind), 
                domain = NA)
        if (sample.kind == 0L) 
            warning("non-uniform 'Rounding' sampler used", domain = NA)
        if (sample.kind == length(s.kinds) - 1L) 
            sample.kind <- -1L
    }
    .Internal(set.seed(seed, i.knd, normal.kind, sample.kind))
}
<bytecode: 0x000001863ce65c00>
<environment: namespace:base>

coords<- (runif(2))
print(coords)

[1] 0.3285496 0.7307598

r<- sqrt(coords[1]^2 +coords[2]^2)
theta<-atan(coords[2]/ coords[1])
polar<- c(r=r,theta=theta)
print(polar)

        r     theta 
0.8012208 1.1482751 



Q4
I updated the vector to the line for the arc according to the homework. Then I searched the vector for the character “aphid” to find the number in line. The aphid is 4th in line.

queue<- c("sheep", "fox", "owl", "ant")
queue<- c("sheep", "fox", "owl", "ant","serpent")
queue<- c("sheep", "fox", "owl", "ant","serpent","sheep")
queue<- c("donkey","sheep", "fox", "owl", "ant","serpent","sheep")
queue<- c("donkey","sheep", "fox", "owl", "ant","sheep")
queue<- c("donkey","sheep", "fox", "ant","sheep")
queue<- c("donkey","sheep", "fox", "aphid","ant","sheep")

match(queue,"aphid")

[1] NA NA NA  1 NA NA




Q5

q<-c(seq(1:100))
v<- q[which(q %% 2 != 0 & q %% 3 != 0 & q %% 7 != 7)]

print (v)

 [1]  1  5  7 11 13 17 19 23 25 29 31 35 37 41 43 47 49 53 55 59 61 65 67 71 73
[26] 77 79 83 85 89 91 95 97
